title: LSASS Memory Capture (Sanitized)
summary: Synthesized from public Mimikatz training walk-throughs showing how logonpasswords exposes cached secrets. All secrets are sanitized or well-known sentinels.

records.context: Interactive logon for the default administrator account.
records.explanation: Hash corresponds to the blank-password sentinel often highlighted in incident response labs to confirm an account was disabled or left without a password.

records.context: Service account scheduled for nightly database exports.
records.explanation: Synthetic password illustrates why operational service accounts should use managed secrets or gMSA instead of static strings.

records.context: SQL operator service configured for constrained delegation.
records.explanation: Key bytes truncated from Microsoft workshop examples to show how AES keys appear when exported for offline cracking practice.

title: Token Cache Review
summary: Highlights delegated and impersonation tokens that simulated attackers frequently replay. Values are shortened hexadecimal strings, not live handles.

records.context: Helpdesk analyst with temporary domain admin elevation.
records.explanation: Hex blob trimmed from pass-the-token labs to demonstrate why privileged sessions should be short lived and monitored.

records.context: IIS application pool identity servicing intranet portals.
records.explanation: Shows how web tier identities inherit user context and why IIS hardening guides recommend isolating pools.

title: Kerberos Ticket Cache
summary: Sample Kerberos material taken from red-team lab environments with hostnames anonymized.

records.context: Golden ticket example using anonymized realm identifiers.
records.explanation: Snippet demonstrates the long-lived nature of forged TGTs without distributing a full usable ticket.
Hex digest mirrors kerberoasting tutorials and underlines why SPN accounts require strong, rotated credentials.
